div1.p: Strong congratulates Kean for his review of the Gorgas biography.

div1.head: Letter from Richard A. Strong to Jefferson Randolph Kean, March 24, 1925
div1.opener:
DEPARTMENT OF TROPICAL MEDICINE
HARVARD UNIVERSITY MEDICAL SCHOOL
Boston, Mass., March 24, 1925.
Colonel J. R. Kean, Editor,
The Military Surgeon,
Army Medical Museum & Library,
Seventh & B Sts. S.W., Washington, D.C.
My dear Colonel Kean:
div1.p:
I appreciate very much your kindness in sending me
the reprint of your editorial review of the biography of
General Gorgas. I fully realize your desire to see fair play
in all matters of this kind and certainly in this wonderful
work there is enough credit for all concerned to share in. It is
unfortunate that no mention of your own work is made in
connection with the editorial, but it is quite evident
that your own modesty did not permit you to do this.

Again thanking you for the article in which I
have been greatly interested, I am with kind regards
div1.closer: Yours very sincerely, Richard A Strong S/CMC
